title: Pervasive Language Learning Design Using Mixed Reality: Contextual Professional Terminology and Dialogue Scenario Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Possesses intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, with basic grammar and job-related vocabulary comprehension
context.additional_context: Context-based language learning enhancement for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to apply skills in real work environments. Focus on improving expressive competence, reading comprehension, and professional communication abilities.

learning_goals: Learners can use specialized terminology and vocabulary in the medical, legal, and technical fields with 80% accuracy in a real-world task simulation environment utilizing AR technology.

Learners can design and execute context-specific dialogue scenarios (e.g., medical consultations, legal negotiations, technical briefings) in the target language three or more times by integrating physical spaces with digital content.

Learners collaborate with 4–5 team members to create project-based language content (e.g., digital storytelling, podcast scripts) in a pervasive learning environment (online collaboration tools, mobile apps) over two weeks, achieving scores of 80% or higher in four out of five evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, linguistic accuracy, collaboration, professionalism, contextual relevance).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
